abstract.li: Activity recording provides the necessary links to record what happens to a product, either as usage of the product, or by way of maintenance, or of anything else that is significant in the life of the product.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of records of completed activities, including the use of resources. It extends the capability of Ap239_work_definition (10303-1307) using the module Activity_as_realized (10303-1259) to assert that the work described has actually taken place. Capability is also provided to characterize the recorded activity, in term of who collected the information, under what circumstance; to identify the product on which work was performed, and to relate the recorded activity to the work order, work requests and work definition from which it arose. In addition, the module enables the recording of observations to capture information which is not allowed for in the definition of the work. Although much of the content of within this module relates to the use of Observation (10303-1258), this covers only a few per cent of the total capability, most of which is achieved by use from Activity_as_realized (10303-1269) and Resource_as_realized (10303-1269).

inscope.li: recording the usage of a product;
recording the maintenance activities on a product;
recording the use of resources during usage of a product;
recording the use of resources during the maintenance of a product;
recording observations against a product or its support solution;
relating the record of an activity to the work order, work request and work definition from which it arose.

outscope.li: recording the status or configuration of a product;
defining a usage or maintenance of a product.
